column4: Ummm....What do i do if i forget my USERNAME! (I set my sister up a pc and gave her her own username but forgot it...)
I would boot into recovery mode, add a new user and add them to admin group
How...
adduser will add a user, but I forget how to add someone to a group
I just found on Ubuntu forums to do revovery mode them cd /home then type ls... Seems so obvious.
Oh, yeah. I don't know why I didn't think of that :)
What kind of modem? (I am interested in this sort of thing)
OK, I've never heard of that :)
Its a wireless modem but i only have one D-Link. I already was using the ethernet on the back so i went for a risk and Tried ubuntu with the usb connection. And it worked.
Do you mean /etc/hosts?
? Will i be able to block sites like in windows with it?
For what?
For making a 35gig partition from my 70 gig partion.
Easy. Open it up, making sure that the partition isn't mounted, select it, right click, resize/move, fiddle it around a bit, apply, exit
The hard drive doesn't matter, only the partition. If the partition is not currently mounted then you can mess around with it in GParted
If it is being used then you can use an Ubuntu LiveCD to shrink it, since the Live CD doesn't need the hard drive to be mounted
If you don't have an Ubuntu CD then the GParted Live CD is a much smaller download
I would say either use soundconverter to make it low quality Ogg Vorbis (saves even more space because it has better compression) or extract it to Wave with soundconverter and use lame to reencode it
OK, I would say either soundconverter or "mpg123 -w file.mp3" to get a wave, then "lame -b XX file.wav"
I got lame to do it. Just how can i make it do it to a folder?
I don't know, you might need to find a script (Perl or Python probably)
